title: Nobody knows what is going to happen, least of all we the people
text:
No wonder blind party loyalty is dead - Our politicians have hardly covered themselves in glory of late.

Crikey. It’s put up or shut up time. Our turn. We, the people, have finally been given the vote. Before you ask, it’s not the same as the People’s Vote, apparently. Except it sounds suspiciously as if it might be, sort of. Either way, after these long, excruciating months (years) on the sidelines, watching our elected members endlessly tussling over amendments like schoolboys scrapping at the Eton Wall, we now have a voice.

But what, exactly, do we want to say? (Keep it clean, folks.) For all the experts bullishly projecting a clear Conservative majority, a collapse of Labour, a resurgence...
description: No wonder blind party loyalty is dead - Our politicians have hardly covered themselves in glory of late.
